definition: to get into a habit/to become addicted
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Sceptics say there is nothing uniquely addictive about the internet.
sentences.chinese: 怀疑论者以为，互联网并无让人上瘾的特性。

sentences.english: Sounds a lot like other addictions, Pine said.
sentences.chinese: 派恩称，这和很多其它上瘾行为的后果类似。

sentences.english: What do you think of people who are addicted to plastic surgery?
sentences.chinese: 你是如何看待那些整容上瘾的人呢？

sentences.english: And when you have an addiction, you struggle with it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你对什么东西上瘾，你就要在生活中与之斗争。

sentences.english: The nucleus accumbens is known to play a role in the addictive effect of drugs.
sentences.chinese: 并且这一区域也在药物上瘾中扮演着关键角色。

sentences.english: Ambition is a drug that makes its addicts potential madmen.
sentences.chinese: 野心是一种毒品，它会使那些有疯癫潜质的人上瘾。

sentences.english: That study has implications for drug addiction and other compulsive behaviors.
sentences.chinese: 这个实验也可说明毒品上瘾和其它强迫行为。

sentences.english: Bettys Beer Bar is completely addicting board game fun.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂斯啤酒酒吧是完全上瘾的棋盘游戏的乐趣。
它非常容易上瘾，就像咖啡因一样。

sentences.english: Challenge yourself in this addictive, easy to use, old-school arcade racing game.
sentences.chinese: 挑战自己，在此上瘾，容易使用，老派街机赛车游戏。

sentences.english: I admit it. I’m hooked on caffeine.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，我承认，我对咖啡因有点上瘾了。

sentences.english: Traffic data can be addicting at times.
sentences.chinese: 有时流量数据会让人上瘾。

sentences.english: And so, I ended up using it, and it's caught on.
sentences.chinese: 所以我也开始用，而且已经上瘾了。

sentences.english: It is mildly addictive, one possible reason that makers of soft drinks add it to their products.
sentences.chinese: 由于有点让人上瘾，常被加入到软饮产品中。

sentences.english: In fact, for many people it can be very addicting.

definition: want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
to become excited with/to be enchanted by
to quit/to give up (a bad habit)
to fall in love with/to be in love with
to resume smoking (after giving up)/to relapse into smoking or drug abuse
